commit message: Added link to Kickstarter and Youtube video
Update to newest version of ActionBarSherlock
The robot sends the entire MCU name
Update abs, support library and maven android plugin
Now using Intellij instead of Eclipse
Simplified some things as suggested by Intellij
Cleaned up the code a bit
Can now set Kalman variances remotely as well
minSdkVersion and targetSdkVersion will be read from the manifest
No need to include jar for GraphView anymore
Use SeekBars to set PID values
Gradle will automatically turn debug on and off
Gradle can now update AndroidManifest and accessory_filter
Improved the way it updates the accessory_filter
Removed pom file as it's no longer used
Set minSdkVersion and targetSdkVersion in build.gradle
No devices string shouldn't be selectable
New version of GraphView will redraw whenever a series is added or removed
Now able to change page more easily in the Joystick tab

ActionBarSherlock is now available at Maven Central

Reverted back to using ActionBarSherlock, as it looked better

Added scrollview for PID and Graph view, so it's visible on some small devices running Android 2.3

Also adjusted indent
Added Android ViewPagerIndicator as a submodule
The Balanduino won't send 'V' after battery level anymore
Added write string function to bluetooth chat service
Gradle wrapper is no longer needed in 1.7
Added Physicaloid Library as a submodule

Set ranges back again for seekbars

This is needed until the PID library is implemented
Fixed problem with ViewPagerIndicator in landscape mode

Merge branch 'indicator' into dev

Conflicts:
build.gradle
PID page should fill up entire view
Combine PID and info tab when in landscape mode
The robot now sends the EEPROM version as well and will automatically send the status report

Added .aar archives of libraries instead of compiling the submodule

This should make it easier for others to compile the code

Merge branch 'master' into upload

Conflicts:
.gitmodules
build.gradle
settings.gradle

Can now upload to an Uno

Still need to add support for the ATmega1284P in the Physicaloid library
Moved flavor sourceSets into main one
Check if it got permission before trying to upload
Set uses-feature for usb flavor using custom Manifest
Set different packageName for each flavor
Close serial communication when the user exits the app
Compile multiple APK's as described here: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/connectivity/usb/host.html
Updated Physicaloid Library, so .hex files larger than 65536 bytes can be uploaded
Changed log level from error to debug
Download hex from Github before uploading

Revert: 7a227d06b843312b48e4789eddbf9ffd8bf4d5bc, as it would open a new activity on top of the new one

This is also an issue when using the accessory, but since it will not be used very often it will stay there for now
Moved menu_upload back into main res directory
Use image hosted on Wiki instead
Put Upload.java into com.tkjelectronics.balanduino path, so Intellij (Android Studio) doesn't complain

Revert 'Revert: 7a227d06b843312b48e4789eddbf9ffd8bf4d5bc, as it would open a new activity on top of the new one'

This reverts commit 63221c1fe2cd668918228ea4638bc19066e8510d.
Moved upload button into settings dialog
Use custom square LinearLayout, so graph tab shows up correctly on small devices
Added ScrollView for info tab as well

Updated PhysicaloidLibrary

Now check if connection is open before trying to close it
All log are now disabled in PhysicaloidLibrary when doing a release
Stop retrying to connect if DeviceListActivity is opened again
Forgot to add res.srcDirs for basic flavor after c56e5ea4b8572f5e9552454cbadcde1214b0a11b
Only main activity should have launchMode set to singleTask or Bluetooth doesn't work
